p: Participants in all three analogy conditions rated their passages as more helpful than control participants; this effect was particularly strong for the medical analogy (MA: b = 0.77, t(347) = 4.64, p < .001, sr 2 = .06; DA: b = 0.35, t(347) = 2.09, p < .05, sr 2 = .01; TA: b = 0.42, t(347) = 2.41, p < .05, sr 2 = .02). Political ideology also affected reported helpfulness, with liberals rating the analogy passages as more helpful to their thinking about climate change than conservatives, b = 0.20, t(346) = 3.33, p < .001, sr 2 = .03. Political ideology did not interact with any of the analogy conditions.
